alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 3:40PM EDT until June 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONROE AND NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 340 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Analomink to Stormville to near Wind Gap, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... East Stroudsburg, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Henryville, Delaware Water Gap, Tannersville, Alpine Mountain, Reeders, Saylorsburg, Analomink, McMichael, Scotrun, Echo Lake, Paradise Valley and Brodheadsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 297 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
